get.summary: Get issues within a project filterable by query parameters.
get.description:
Gets all issues within the project specified by the query parameter `projectId`, and optionally filtered by various parameters.

**Basic Filtering:**
- **Multiple IDs**: Pass several `id` values to retrieve multiple issues at once
- **POAM IDs**: Pass several `poamId` values to retrieve multiple issues (requires `projectId`)

**Content Filtering:**
- **`deviationType`**: Retrieve issues containing deviations of the specified type
- **`title`**: Retrieve issues whose title contains the provided string (case-insensitive)
- **`kev`**: Retrieve issues containing CVE IDs present in the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog
- **`cveId`**: Retrieve issues containing the specified CVE identifier (OR logic for multiple CVE IDs)
- **`asset`**: Retrieve issues with at least one of the provided asset names (case-sensitive, exact match)

**Date Range Filtering:**

Date ranges are inclusive. You may provide one side of the date range to get an unbounded range. Date format for all filters: YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., "2024-01-01")
- **Effective Date**: Use `effectiveDateStart` and `effectiveDateEnd` (filters the `createdAt` field returned by the API)
- **Due Date**: Use `dueDateStart` and `dueDateEnd`
- **Status Date**: Use `statusDateStart` and `statusDateEnd`

parameters.description: User defined identifier for this issue. You may pass in several `poamId` values at once. If used, the projectId is required.

post.summary: Submit intake data for an assessment
post.description:
## Overview
Uploads a CSV, XML, JSON, or Nessus file as an artifact and attaches it to the intake on a vulnerability or configuration assessment specified by the `assessmentId`. Only CSV, XML, JSON, and Nessus files are supported.

Maximum file size: 10 GB.

### Effective Date Handling
The effective date specified will be used to determine what cycle(s) to upload the artifact to. If no effective date is specified, the current date will be used as the effective date.

### Cycle Creation and Management
The artifact will be added to the intake for each cycle on the assessment whose start and end date overlap the artifact's effective date. If no such cycle can be found, a new one will be created. The created cycle's start date will be the beginning of the effective date's month. The cycle's end date will be calculated based on the assessment's frequency.

### Evidence Handling
If the intake on the cycle does not have an attached evidence, the evidence from the previous cycle's intake will be used. If there is no previous cycle, a new evidence will be created.

### Multiple Cycle Behavior
If multiple cycles fall within the range of the artifact's effective date, the artifact will be attached to each cycle's intake. If the multiple cycle intakes have different evidences, one artifact will be created for each evidence.

### Existing Artifacts
If any of the cycle intakes already have artifacts attached, the new artifact will be added without removing existing artifacts.

parameters.name: assessmentId
parameters.description: An id that represents an assessment within the Paramify application.

file.description:
The file to be uploaded as an artifact. Any file type is supported. The original filename will be preserved and used as the default title if no title is specified in the metadata.

**IMPORTANT**: Filenames containing certain special characters may cause upload errors. URL-encode your filename to avoid issues -- it will be decoded automatically.

schema.description: An array of newly created artifacts. Typically only one artifact will be created, unless multiple assessment cycles overlap the effective date and have different evidences attached to their intakes. At least one artifact will always be created if the request was successful.

post.summary: Attach an existing CSV, XML, JSON, or Nessus file artifact to an assessment cycle's intake
post.description:
## Overview
Attaches an existing CSV, XML, JSON, or Nessus file artifact to the intake of the assessment cycle specified by the `assessmentId` and `cycleId`. Only file artifacts with a CSV, XML, JSON, or Nessus file will be accepted. The specified cycle must be a cycle on the specified assessment.

### Evidence Handling
If the cycle's intake does not have an attached evidence, the evidence the artifact is attached to will automatically be attached to the intake. If the evidence attached to the cycle's intake is different from the evidence that the artifact is on, an error will be thrown.

### Existing Artifacts
If the cycle's intake already has artifacts attached, the new artifact will be added without removing existing artifacts.
